I initially believed that this story is true. Somebody has to prove that Saffy did abortions by investigating the victims of him. Most of the allegations against him are predetermined and showing hatred against Muslims. Having a pleasure by blaming him with baseless points is simply very bad for Buddhists. At this stage complainers are becoming more and more silent. And now I have doubts over this allegation.

But of course there will many "geniuses" here who still wouldn't accept the learned opinions of actual doctors (whether based in England or otherwise) and would continue to insist that the Kurunegala doctor DID sterilise scores of women.  I have still to see any ACTUAL evidence of that. And I still have yet to see anyone mount a successfull reply to this; if this guy did what some are alleging, how did he do it while under the gaze and in the same room as countless other doctors, midwives, attendants, nurses etc?
